title: Who is Bake Off winner David's partner and how often did David win Star Baker?
text:
David is your 2019 Bake Off champion (Picture: Channel 4)

The Great British Bake Off 2019 has crowned its winner, with David Atherton being named series champion in Tuesday night’s final.

David – who was the last man standing in the competition – fought off competition from Alice Fevronia and Steph Blackwell to take the coveted cake plate, after his picnic basket-themed showstopper wowed Paul and Prue.

‘I have watched this since the second series,’ he said afterwards.

‘For nine years I have been daydreaming about Bake Off, it wasn’t in my mind I could win this. ‘I was always the underdog but I managed to get through.’

Here’s what you need to know about David – and why his victory hasn’t been popular with everybody.

Who is Bake Off winner David’s partner?

The final saw us introduced to David’s partner Nik Sariyski.

We don’t know a whole lot about Nik – who appeared on the show briefly in the segment about David’s family and loved ones, as well as attending the party at the very end – but according to The Sun he’s a visual merchandising manager at Nike, who also speaks four languages.

We also learned at the very end of the show that since taking part David and Nik have moved in together.

Advertisement

Advertisement

How many times did David win Star Baker?

Many viewers expected Steph – who was Star Baker four times – to take the title (Picture: Channel 4)

Despite being crowned series champion David never actually took the Star Baker accolade during the series.

He had been the outsider to take the title behind favourite Steph Blackwell – who won the coveted honour four times – and Alice Fevronia, who was named Star Baker twice during the series, including in last week’s semi-final.

However Steph didn’t have the best time of it in the tent during the final, coming a cropper when her souffles failed to rise during the technical challenge, leaving her in tears.

David went on to win the technical as well as impress the judges in the showstopper, with an ‘edible illusion’ picnic basket featuring cake shaped like blocks of cheese and fig rolls made to look like sausage rolls.

Why are people angry that David won?

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Some viewers were not happy that David took the title due to the fact that he was never named Star Baker even once during the series.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘How the f** has David, who hasn’t won star baker ONCE in the entire 10 weeks, just won Bake Off ????’ one viewer said on Twitter, while another added: ‘Fuming David won #GBBO Steph has been amazing throughout and had at least one star baker numerous times.’

Others took to Twitter to make their feelings known.

Although David did have plenty of supporters too, with some pointing out that he had deserved Star Baker in previous weeks despite not winning it.

The Great British Bake Off returns in 2020.

description: David Atherton is your Great British Bake Off 2019 champion - here's what you need to know about him.
